intro: Lactuca crambifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows. Lactuca crambifolia is not typically cultivated for food but is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
